Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge — Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo (First appearance)
metadata.title: Black Spire Mousse

metadata.content:
# Fuzzy Tauntaun - Behind the scenes[]

Fuzzy Tauntauns were first mentioned in the junior novel Pirate's Price, which was written by Lou Anders and published on January 8, 2019. On February 27 of that year, D23: The Official Disney Fan Club and StarWars.com announced that the beverage, which was first pictured on the latter website, would be sold at the real-world bar Oga's Cantina in Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, a themed land that opened at Disneyland Park on May 31 and Disney's Hollywood Studios on August 29 of the same year. The menu's description reads, "Cîroc Peach Vodka, Bols Peach Schnapps, and Simply Orange® topped with Tangerine, Pure Cane Sugar, 'Buzzz' Foam." The real-world "buzzz" is derived from buzz buttons.

The 2020 non-canon video game expansion The Sims 4 Star Wars: Journey to Batuu includes Fuzzy Tauntauns as a drink that the player's Sims can purchase from the Oga's Cantina vendor in the Black Spire Outpost neighborhood. Its price of sixty credits makes it the second most expensive item on the menu. Upon consuming the drink for the first time, the Sim automatically learns the recipe and can prepare it at mixology bars in their home neighborhood.
metadata.title: Fuzzy Tauntaun

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Mousse - Behind the scenes[]

Black Spire Mousse is a dessert available at the real-world at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge in Disney's Hollywood Studios starting in June 2024. The dish is described as "White Chocolate Jogan Fruit Mousse atop a Brownie Pistachio Brittle served with Blue Milk Sauce, Pineapple Cream, and Hibiscus Sponge topped with a Chocolate Black Spire Coin."
metadata.title: Black Spire Mousse

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Mousse - Appearances[]

Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge — Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo (First appearance)
metadata.title: Black Spire Mousse

metadata.content:
# Black Spire Brew

Black Spire Brew


Historical information

Found
Black Spire Outpost, Batuu



Food specifications

Type
Caffeinated beverage


Physical description
Sweet and cold brown liquid topped with a speared green hemisphere and smaller dark spheres


Plant-based ingredients
Fruit


Other ingredients
CafHoney


Potable by
Humans



Chronological information

Affiliation
Oga's Cantina


[Source]

Black Spire Brew was a brown-colored, caf-based beverage. It was served cold over ice in a tall glass with a speared fruit garnish consisting of a speared green hemisphere and smaller dark spheres. The caffeinated drink was served at Oga's Cantina in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu, where it was considered richer than Spiran caf.

During the Clone Wars, the cantina's bartender Janott listed the drink among those available for the human Senator Padmé Amidala to consume when she visited the cantina. The drink was still available in 34 ABY.
metadata.title: Black Spire Brew

Black Spire Mousse was a dessert served at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu in 34 ABY. The dish was based around Jogan fruit mousse with Blue milk sauce, and was served with a chocolate coin adorned with the emblem of Black Spire Outpost.
metadata.title: Black Spire Mousse

categories: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook recipes
metadata.content:
# Blurrgfire - Behind the scenes[]

Blurrgfire was first mentioned on a trading card available at Disney's December 16, 2017 "Galactic Nights" session, which featured the cantina in the upcoming Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge park area. At the real-world Oga's Cantina bar, the menu's description reads, "Lemonade, pomegranate juice, and habanero-lime."

Blurrgfire first appeared in "G-LN," a short that aired on December 17, 2018 as part of the first season of the animated television series Star Wars Resistance. During its appearance, Blurrgfire was depicted as a pale orange substance as opposed to the deep red coloring it was depicted with in its other appearances.

A recipe for Blurrgfire is included in the 2019 cookbook Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was written by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel and Marc Sumerak with photography by Ted Thomas. The ingredients for the beverage are pomegranate juice, habanero lime syrup, and prepared lemonade; before serving, a lime is run around the rim of a glass which is then dipped in red sea salt.

The 2020 non-canon video game expansion The Sims 4 Star Wars: Journey to Batuu includes Blurrgfire as a drink sold to the player's Sims at the Oga's Cantina vendor in the Black Spire Outpost neighborhood. Upon consuming the drink for the first time, the Sim automatically learns the recipe and can prepare it at mixology bars in their home neighborhood.
metadata.title: Blurrgfire

# Black Spire Hot Chocolate - Behind the scenes[]

Black Spire Hot Chocolate was added to the menus of Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo and Ronto Roasters after the initial opening of Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. The menu description is, "Hot chocolate topped with brown sugar whip cream."

categories: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook recipes
metadata.content:
# Moogan Tea - Galaxy's Edge and cookbook recipe[]

Moogan Tea appeared at the out-of-universe Oga's Cantina bar in the themed land Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. It was announced to the public on February 27, 2019, and it debuted for guests to purchase when the land opened in Disneyland Park on May 31 and Disney's Hollywood Studios on August 29 of that year. The menu's description reads, "Gold Peak® Unsweetened Tea, Chocolate Milk, Vanilla, and Cinnamon, topped with Vanilla Whipped Cream, Cinnamon & Sugar-dusted Cereal."

A recipe for Moogan Tea is included in the cookbook Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was written by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel and Marc Sumerak with photography by Ted Thomas and published on November 5, 2019. The book clarified that Moogan Tea and Ardees Beverage are different drinks. The recipe uses the ingredients unsweetened iced tea, chocolate milk, Moogan Spice Syrup, heavy cream, falernum, and a sprinkling of Christophsian sugar mixed with ground cinnamon. Recipes for Moogan Spice Syrup and Christophsian sugar are also included in the book.
metadata.title: Moogan Tea

categories: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook recipes
metadata.content:
# Hyperdrive (Punch It!) - Behind the scenes[]

Hyperdrive (Punch It!) is one of the non-alcoholic beverages sold to customers in the real-world Oga's Cantina bar in the themed land Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge at Disneyland Park and Disney's Hollywood Studios. It was officially announced to the public on February 27, 2019 in an article on the website D23: The Official Disney Fan Club and debuted for guests to purchase when the land opened at its respective parks on May 31 and August 29 of that year. A video released on July 24 by the Disney Parks Blog depicted the drink being made and shared that the in-universe cantina was powered by a hyperdrive. The menu's description reads, "Powerade® Mountain Berry Blast, White Cranberry Juice, Black Cherry Purée, and Sprite®."

An out-of-universe recipe for the beverage is included in the 2019 cookbook Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was written by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel and Marc Sumerak with photography by Ted Thomas. The ingredients are white cranberry juice or white grape juice, berry-flavored blue sports drink, lemon-lime soda, and black cherry purée.
metadata.title: Hyperdrive (Punch It!)

metadata.content:
# Oga's Obsession - Behind the scenes[]

Oga's Obsession first appeared as a beverage sold to guests at the Oga's Cantina bar in the themed attraction Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge upon its debut in Disneyland Park on May 31, 2019. The dish was first revealed in an article on D23: The Official Disney Fan Club identifying the dish as "Cantina mix" on February 27 of the same year. The following day, the snack was first identified as Oga's Obsession in a StarWars.com article. The dish is served in a container that resembles a petri dish. The menu lists it as a "provision" and describes it as "Minute Maid® Lemonade, Cotton Candy Flavor, and Blueberry Flavor–filled Boba, with a bursting Dried Fruit Mixture." An alcoholic version of Oga's Obsession called the Rodian Ration is available exclusively at the Walt Disney World location of Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge.
metadata.title: Oga's Obsession

[Source]


The Garra Outpost Roll was a provision served at Oga's Cantina on the Outer Rim planet Batuu in 34 ABY. The dish was named after the cantina's Blutopian proprietor Oga Garra and was served in honor of her birthday. It was edible by humans.
metadata.title: Garra Outpost Roll

metadata.content:
# Garra Outpost Roll - Behind the scenes[]

The Garra Outpost Roll first appeared as a provision available to guests at the real-world Oga's Cantina in the themed land Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge at Disneyland in Anaheim, California, exclusively for Star Wars Nites in 2023. The dish returned later that summer from July 18 to July 20, 2023 as a celebration of Oga Garra's birthday. The menu described it as a "seaweed rice roll with pickled vegetables, spiced ham paté, Fresno chiles, and salty and tangy chile sauce."
metadata.title: Garra Outpost Roll

metadata.content:
# Batuubucha Tea

Batuubucha Tea


Historical information

Homeworld
Batuu



Food specifications

Type
Tea


Physical description
Orange-colored, fruity, and bubbly liquid


Plant-based ingredients
FruitsFermented tea


Potable by
Humans



Chronological information

Affiliation
Tuggs' Grub at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo


[Source]

Batuubucha Tea was a fruit-flavored tea from Batuu that was fermented and bubbly, and was rumored to have health benefits. After centuries of enjoyment by local Batuuans, it gained popularity among the wealthy of the Core Worlds.

In 34 ABY, Batuubucha tea was served at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo in Black Spire Outpost. When Strono Tuggs was the visiting chef, he sold it at his mobile restaurant, Tuggs' Grub. Ylena, who was a member of the Gatherers on Batuu and a Resistance supporter, drank the tea when she had lunch with Dolin before he assisted with sabotaguing the First Order's mobile habitat.
metadata.title: Batuubucha Tea

metadata.content:

Batuuan Beef Pot Roast

Plant-based ingredients

Other ingredients

Edible by

Chronological information

Affiliation
Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo


[Source]

Batuuan Beef Pot Roast was a meat dish served at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu in 34 ABY. It was suitable for consumption by humans. Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs made it with Batuuan cows that were grass-fed on Naboo, along with mushrooms, greens, and pasta.
metadata.title: Batuuan Beef Pot Roast

metadata.content:
# Batuubucha Tea - Behind the scenes[]

This drink is found at all mealtimes in the real world Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge in Disneyland only. The menu's description reads, "Suja pineapple passionfruit kombucha."
metadata.title: Batuubucha Tea

metadata.content:
# Batuuan Beef Pot Roast - Behind the scenes[]

Batuuan Beef Pot Roast was introduced in the real world as Braised Shaak Roast at the Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo eatery in Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, where it has been available with differing names since the opening in 2019. The dish consists of a beef pot roast with cavatelli pasta, wilted kale, and mushrooms. A recipe for the dish as Braised Shaak Roast is included in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, written by Marc Sumerak and Chelsea Monroe-Cassel. Unlike the in-universe version of Braised Shaak Roast, Batuuan Beef Pot Roast does not use shaak.
metadata.title: Batuuan Beef Pot Roast

metadata.content:
# Batuuan Beef Pot Roast - Appearances[]

Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge — Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo (First appearance)
metadata.title: Batuuan Beef Pot Roast

metadata.content:
# Batuu Spice - Behind the scenes[]

Batuu Spice was available in the real world at the Star Wars: Galactic Starcruiser hotel in Walt Disney World Resort, Florida, which opened to the public on March 1, 2022. It was last served at the hotel during the September 28–30 voyage of 2023, the final voyage before the closure of Star Wars: Galactic Starcruiser.
metadata.title: Batuu Spice

Batuu Spice was a sauce served with spiral dumplings. In 34 ABY, the sweet and creamy sauce was served during the second course of dinner at An Evening with Gaya in the Crown of Corellia Dining Room on the MPO-1400 Purgill-class star cruiser Halcyon. The sauce was safe for humans to consume.

metadata.content:
# Dagobah Slug Slinger - Behind the scenes[]

Dagobah Slug Slinger is one of the alcoholic beverages sold to customers in the real-world Oga's Cantina bar in the themed land Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. It was officially announced to the public on February 27, 2019 in an article on the website D23: The Official Disney Fan Club, and debuted for guests to purchase when the land opened in Disneyland Park and Disney's Hollywood Studios in 2019. The menu's description reads, "Herradura Reposado Tequila, Bols Blue Curaçao, Citrus Juices, Ginger, Herbs, and Bitters." On November 18, 2024, the drink was removed from the menu at Disney's Hollywood Studios, while the drink was retired from the Disneyland version's menu sometime after April 23, 2021.

An out-of-universe recipe for the cocktail is included in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, written by Marc Sumerak and Chelsea Monroe-Cassel with photography by Ted Thomas. It is made with the ingredients Dagobah Slug Syrup, lime juice, orange juice, blue curaçao, tequila, and water. They are combined and shaken, then poured over ice and garnished with a sprig of rosemary.

The 2020 non-canon video game expansion The Sims 4 Star Wars: Journey to Batuu includes Dagobah Slug Slingers as a drink sold to the player's Sims at the Oga's Cantina vendor in the Black Spire Outpost neighborhood. Upon consuming the drink for the first time, the Sim automatically learns the recipe and can prepare it at mixology bars in their home neighborhood.
metadata.title: Dagobah Slug Slinger

metadata.content:
# Batuu Bits - Behind the scenes[]

Batuu Bits is a snack available at Oga's Cantina bar in Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. It is made up mostly of dried spicy snacks like tortilla chips, dried fish, and wasabi peas. The menus at Disney's Hollywood Studios describe it as "crispy galaxy snack bits with spiced chermoula dip," while the Disneyland menu calls it "a light crisp Snack Mix from the galaxy." When it was initially announced, it did not yet have its final name and was referred to as "Cantina Mix."
metadata.title: Batuu Bits

vectors.title: Batuuan Beef and Crispy Topato Stir-fry

metadata.content:
# Batuuan Beef and Crispy Topato Stir-fry - Behind the scenes[]

Batuuan Beef and Crispy Topato Stir-fry is an entrée available at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge in Disney's Hollywood Studios. It is not available at the restaurant's Disneyland location. The dish released as part of a 2021 menu refresh at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo. The menu describes the dish as "Smoky Braised Beef glazed in Tamarind Sauce. Served with Stir Fried Mushrooms and Vegetables, Crispy Herb Yucca, Pickled Onions, and Cilantro."
metadata.title: Batuuan Beef and Crispy Topato Stir-fry

Dessert


Other ingredients

Edible by
Human



Chronological information

Affiliation
Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo


[Source]


A Batuu-bon was a sweet dessert served at Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Black Spire Outpost on Batuu. It was a spherical chocolate cake with a caf-flavored filling. The pastry was topped with a small disk-shaped chocolate treat depicting an emblem of Black Spire Outpost.
metadata.title: Batuu-bon

metadata.content:
# Batuu-bon - Behind the scenes[]

Batuu-bon is a dessert found in the real-world Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo at Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. The menu's description reads, "Chocolate cake, white chocolate mousse, coffee custard." The dessert also includes a small chocolate coin.
metadata.title: Batuu-bon

metadata.content:

 Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge — Docking Bay 7 Food and Cargo (First appearance)
metadata.title: Batuu-bon

metadata.content:
# Fuzzy Tauntaun - Behind the scenes[]

Fuzzy Tauntauns were first mentioned in the junior novel Pirate's Price, which was written by Lou Anders and published on January 8, 2019. On February 27 of that year, D23: The Official Disney Fan Club and StarWars.com announced that the beverage, which was first pictured on the latter website, would be sold at the real-world bar Oga's Cantina in Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, a themed land that opened at Disneyland Park on May 31 and Disney's Hollywood Studios on August 29 of the same year. The menu's description reads, "Cîroc Peach Vodka, Bols Peach Schnapps, and Simply Orange® topped with Tangerine, Pure Cane Sugar, 'Buzzz' Foam." The real-world "buzzz" is derived from buzz buttons.

The 2020 non-canon video game expansion The Sims 4 Star Wars: Journey to Batuu includes Fuzzy Tauntauns as a drink that the player's Sims can purchase from the Oga's Cantina vendor in the Black Spire Outpost neighborhood. Its price of sixty credits makes it the second most expensive item on the menu. Upon consuming the drink for the first time, the Sim automatically learns the recipe and can prepare it at mixology bars in their home neighborhood.
metadata.title: Fuzzy Tauntaun
